required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiac Water and Fluoromethane Cardiac PET
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Cardiac Perfusion by O15-water and F17-fluoromethane PET

brief_summary.textblock: In this study we are looking at the blood flow to the heart using two different chemical tags or tracers that give off a low level of radiation. The tracers used in this study are called O15-water and F17-fluoromethane. These tracers mix with the blood and will move through the body. The researchers will use positron emission tomography (PET scans)to track the tracers as they moe through the heart and chest.

primary_outcome.measure: -- implement myocardial perfusion quantification for O15-labeled water at rest and with pharmacologic stress,
primary_outcome.time_frame: assess at time of PET scan

primary_outcome.measure: -- determine the biodistribution of fluoromethane in the thorax to see if it is usable for a cardiac perfusion tracer,
primary_outcome.time_frame: assess at time of PET Scan

secondary_outcome.measure: --develop initial methods for quantification of myocardial perfusion if applicable for labeled fluoromethane.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: assess at time of PET scan

intervention.intervention_name: Cardiac PET imaging- rest and pharmacological stress

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. Age 18 to 40 years old 2. Willing to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. A history of CAD 2. A history of active bronchospasm or asthma on theophylline bronchodilators 3. A history of any cardiac risk factors including: HTN, Diabetes, Hyperlipidemia, Smoking, and premature CAD in immediate family member 4. A history of liver disease or other significant disease 5. Females who are pregnant or lactating
